title: Error with fortran example from fortran90.org
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/112

I tried the example from https://www.fortran90.org/src/rosetta.html

```
lfortranmaster%=$cat test.f90     
integer :: a(3)
a = [1, 2, 3]
print *, shape(a)
print *, size(a)
print *, maxval(a)
print *, minval(a)
print *, sum(a)
end program
lfortranmaster%=$gfortran test.f90
lfortranmaster%=$./a.out
           3
           3
           3
           1
           6
lfortranmaster%=$./lfort test.f90
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/parser/fortranParser.py", line 857, in units
    self._errHandler.sync(self)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/antlr4/error/ErrorStrategy.py", line 220, in sync
    raise InputMismatchException(recognizer)
antlr4.error.Errors.InputMismatchException: None

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./lfort", line 6, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/cli.py", line 132, in main
    e.evaluate(source)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/codegen/evaluator.py", line 120, in evaluate
    ast_tree0 = self.parse(source)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/codegen/evaluator.py", line 53, in parse
    return src_to_ast(source, translation_unit=False)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/ast/utils.py", line 16, in src_to_ast
    return antlr_parse(source, translation_unit)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/parser/parser.py", line 584, in antlr_parse
    parse_tree = parser.units()
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/parser/fortranParser.py", line 918, in units
    self._errHandler.reportError(self, re)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/antlr4/error/ErrorStrategy.py", line 126, in reportError
    self.reportInputMismatch(recognizer, e)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/antlr4/error/ErrorStrategy.py", line 264, in reportInputMismatch
    recognizer.notifyErrorListeners(msg, e.offendingToken, e)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/antlr4/Parser.py", line 314, in notifyErrorListeners
    listener.syntaxError(self, offendingToken, line, column, msg, e)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/antlr4/error/ErrorListener.py", line 60, in syntaxError
    delegate.syntaxError(recognizer, offendingSymbol, line, column, msg, e)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/parser/parser.py", line 36, in syntaxError
    raise utils.SyntaxErrorException(message)
lfortran.ast.utils.SyntaxErrorException: Syntax Error:2:0: mismatched input 'a' expecting {<EOF>, ';', NEWLINE}
a = [1, 2, 3]
^
```
